findings.title: H1: Front-running set could lead to insolvency
findings.description: Front-running set could lead to insolvency due to differing ratios assigned to accJoePerShare or accJoePerFactorPerShare, causing the contract to become unavailable for withdrawals or deposits.

findings.title: M1: pendingTokens may unexpectedly revert
findings.description: The `pendingTokens` view function may revert if no user of the pool owns veJoe tokens, causing unintended consequences.

findings.title: M2: set performs sub before add
findings.description: In the set function of BoostedMasterChefJoe, subtracting before adding can cause arithmetic issues.

findings.title: M3: Usage of solc optimizer
findings.description: The project uses the `solc` optimizer. Enabling the `solc` optimizer may lead to unexpected bugs.

findings.title: W1: OpenZeppelin dependencies contain bugs
findings.description: The project uses outdated versions of @openzeppelin/contracts and @openzeppelin/contracts-upgradeable which are known to have vulnerabilities such as initializer reentrancy and TimelockController vulnerability.

findings.title: W2: Tokens with callbacks
findings.description: Tokens transferred have callbacks which might create re-entrancy possibilities if used in state-changing functions.

findings.title: I1: Use _msgSender over msg.sender
findings.description: BoostedMasterChefJoe has ContextUpgradeable in its inheritance chain. ContextUpgradeable defines the `_msgSender` and `_msgData` functions. This makes it easy to switch their semantics, e.g. if Trader Joe decides to support metatransactions in the future.
